title: Who Is Alexei Navalny, How Is His Health and Why Is the Putin Critic on a Hunger Strike?
sub_head: Opposition leader is serving 2½ years in a penal colony and has complained of poor treatment
body:
Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny is serving a 2½-year prison sentence after being convicted of violating the terms of his parole, including when he was recuperating in Germany after a near-fatal poisoning attempt last year.
Mr. Navalny, a fierce critic of President Vladimir Putin who has a significant reach on social media in Russia, said the threat of jail time was made to deter him from returning to Moscow in January.
His imprisonment effectively sidelined him from protests against the rule of Mr. Putin.
Recently, he has complained of poor treatment in prison and began a hunger strike to protest it and his health started to deteriorate, prompting fears among his supporters that he might die.
Alexei Navalny is Russia’s most prominent opposition leader, a fierce anticorruption activist who has managed to galvanize Russia’s political opposition by exposing flaws in the more than 20-year rule of Mr. Putin.
